alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 13 at 12:37PM EST until December 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Williams, Fulton and Defiance Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tiffin River at Stryker. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect some farm buildings near Stryker and flood some secondary roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Monday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
